Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.datastorage

Class Filter

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.datastorage.Filter
public class Filter
extends Object
This class is used to define one or more conditions for selecting data from a datastorage. A datastorage can be one of the container classes like DataContainer, CSVDataContainer, RSDataContainer or PropertiesDataContanier, or any other object which has implemented getter methods that are using this Filter.

The following sample loads the content of contacts.csv into a CSVDataContainer, and retrieves a filtered list with all surnames that belong to the company LK Test Solutions: 
 Filter fltr = new Filter();
 fltr.addFilterRule("Company", "LK Test Solutions", Filter.Mode.STARTS_WITH);
 dc.getValuesAsList("Surname", fltr);
The next code sample shows an implementation of a check-method, using the Filter class to select data from a data object. 
 public boolean checkValuesFilter(String[] values, Filter fltr) {
        boolean returnCode = false;
        if (fltr.getFilterRules().size() == 0) {
                returnCode = true;
        }
        for (FilterRule fr : fltr.getFilterRules()) {
                returnCode = fr.checkValue(values[getColumnHeaderIndex(fr.getHeaderName())]);
                if (!returnCode) {
                        break;
                }
        }
        return returnCode;
 }
Author:
LK Test Solutions GmbH

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • addFilterRule

      public void addFilterRule​(String rule)

    • addFilterRule

      public void addFilterRule​(FilterRule rule)

    • addFilterRule

      public void addFilterRule​(String headerName, String value, BaseDispatchComponent mode)
      Adds a rule definition into the rules property, that will check a condition against a single value.
      The following sample filters all DataSets where the company name starts with 'LK Test Solutions': 
       
 Filter fltr = new Filter();
 fltr.addFilterRule("Company", "LK Test Solutions", EOperator.STARTS_WITH);
      Parameters:
      headerName - Header of the column or row within a tabular format, where to search for the defined value
      value - The value, which will be checked by the operation.
      mode - The operator that defines the filter operation for the value e.g. EOperator.EQUALS, EOperator.STARTS_WITH, EOperator.CONTAINS etc

    • addFilterRule

      public void addFilterRule​(String headerName, String value, BaseDispatchComponent mode, boolean quoteRuleString)

    • addFilterRule

      public void addFilterRule​(String headerName, String[] values, BaseDispatchComponent mode)
      Adds a rule definition into the rules property, that will check a condition against multiple values. The following sample filters all DataSets where the city equals to Munich, Vienna or Lisboa: 
       
 Filter fltr = new Filter();
 String[] cities = {"Munich", "Vienna", "Lisboa"};
 fltr.addFilterRule("City", cities, EOperator.EQUALS);
      Parameters:
      headerName - Header of the column or row within a tabular format, where to search for the defined values
      values - Array with multiple values, which will be checked by the operation.
      mode - The operator that defines the filter operation for the value e.g. EOperator.EQUALS, EOperator.STARTS_WITH, EOperator.CONTAINS etc

      public void addFilterRule​(String headerName, String[] values, BaseDispatchComponent mode, boolean quoteRuleString)

      public void addFilterRules​(List<FilterRule> r)

    • setPlausibleHeaders

      public void setPlausibleHeaders​(Set<String> headers)
      Sets a Set of plausible headers to the Filter. As soon as this method has been called, only headers equal to the ones in the plausibleHeaders List can be applied to the filter.
      Parameters:
      headers - Set of applicable headers (e.g. column names of a table) - NOT case-sensitive

    • addPlausibleHeaders

      public void addPlausibleHeaders​(Set<String> headers)
      Adds a Set of plausible headers to the filter. As soon as this method has been called, only headers equal to the ones in the plausibleHeaders List can be applied to the filter.
      Parameters:
      headers - Set of applicable headers (e.g. column names of a table) - NOT case-sensitive

    • clearPlausibleHeaders

      public void clearPlausibleHeaders()
      Clears all plausible headers from the filter. After the call of this method, any header can be applied again to the filter.

    • getFilterRules

      public List<FilterRule> getFilterRules()
      Returns the List property rules with elements of type FilterRule
      Returns:
      The property rules of type List.

    • getFilterRulesHeaders

      public List<String> getFilterRulesHeaders()

      public List<String> getFilterRulesValues​(String headerName)

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all entries from the rules List.

    • deleteRule

      public boolean deleteRule​(FilterRule rule)
      Deletes a rule from the filter instance. For example the rule can be created with new FilterRule(), but has to have the same headerName, value and mode as the rule that has to be deleted in the filter.
      Parameters:
      rule - An equal rule to the one that has to be deleted.
      Returns:
      True, if the rule has been deleted, else false.

    • deleteRule

      public boolean deleteRule​(String headerName, String value, BaseDispatchComponent mode)
      Deletes a rule from the filter instance. The rule has to have the same headerName, value and mode as the rule that has to be deleted in the filter.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Header of the column or row within a tabular format.
      value - The value.
      mode - The operator, used to the the values e.g. EOperator.EQUALS, EOperator.STARTS_WITH, EOperator.CONTAINS etc
      Returns:
      True, if the rule has been deleted, else false.

    • deleteRule

      public boolean deleteRule​(String headerName, String[] values, BaseDispatchComponent mode)
      Deletes a rule from the filter instance. The rule has to have the same headerName, values and mode as the rule that has to be deleted in the filter.
      Parameters:
      headerName - Header of the column or row within a tabular format.
      values - The values array.
      mode - The operator, used to the the values e.g. EOperator.EQUALS, EOperator.STARTS_WITH, EOperator.CONTAINS etc
      Returns:
      True, if the rule has been deleted, else false.

    • deleteRule

      public boolean deleteRule​(int index)
      Deletes a rule from the filter instance, specified through an index.
      Parameters:
      index - Index of the rule in the rules property of the filter instance.
      Returns:
      True, if the rule has been deleted, else false.
